answers.answer: We've got a long way to go to pay you back for all you bring to us....glad it worked!  Remember...age doesn't matter unless you're wine or cheese :) Prayers toy ou and Leslee ~ Judie
Hi, I'm glad you're feeling like your self again.  Your post reminded me to continue to take my vitamins.Hope all is well with you and Leslee.Lori

It's an amazing vitamin for anxiety also. They taste good don't they! My mother has always taken alpha lipoic acid for her diabetes.  I am always putting that big teaspoon of cinnamon on my oatmeal in the morning. I have been afraid of getting diabetes on top of this cancer. I don't need both and the chemos do weird things to the blood sugar. You're an amazing mother and friend to everyone on this forum. And 77! That's great. All my best to Leslie. I

Glad you found something natural that works!  It seems amazing to me that so much stuff is out there that can help people but doctors never mention them to anyone.  Dont you feel like you have to be your own "health detective".  Shannon

question: Thank You all for the info on this Vitamine  I have not been feeling too peppy for the past few months and when I read about the B12 sub-lingual on the forum I bought some, did a little research first and found out my Metformin for my diabetus depletes the B12 , Have taken it only 2 days now and I feel like a new woman., and at 77 that is a miracle.  You ladies are a fountain of knowledge.
title: Vitamine B12
